title: Gaza: Qatar says Israel-Hamas truce will be extended by two days
summary: The Palestinian Islamist movement confirmed it had agreed to an extension of the truce. Israel said it had been informed of the identities of the hostages to be released on Monday.

title: Israeli president tells Musk he has 'huge role to play' in fighting anti-Semitism
summary: The owner of the social media platform X, who has been accused by the White House of 'abhorrent promotion' of anti-Semitism, visited Israel, where he met President Isaac Herzog and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: The UK is backing down from its climate ambitions at COP28
summary: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak does not share his predecessor Boris Johnson's concern for the environment, and has announced a number of retreats on key measures to achieve carbon neutrality.

title: French government urges calm after teen's killing
summary: The death of a 16-year-old during a village party has been seized upon by the far right who has portrayed the killing as symbolic of increasingly insecure conditions in French society.

title: The EU fears the consequences of far right victory in the Netherlands
summary: Geert Wilders might not be able to form a coalition, but his platform, which includes abolishing regulations on agriculture and fisheries, banning the European flag from official buildings and even leaving the EU, is causing concern.

title: France's National Marine Museum re-opens in a more contemporary exhibition space
summary: More playful and centered on current issues, the visit still features model ships, paintings and superb figureheads.

title: Why is it that teaching the Holocaust no longer seems to act as a bulwark against anti-Semitism?
summary: The memory of genocide has become insufficient to protect new generations of French people against rejection of the other.

title: Schools in Ukraine grapple with the heavy impact of war
summary: In the Kyiv suburb of Bucha, schoolchildren are back in class, but in areas close to the front line, in-person classes are still the exception. In Kharkiv, classes are sometimes held in metro stations.

title: Man charged in Vermont shooting of Palestinian students
summary: Three university students of Palestinian descent were shot on Saturday as they were walking to the home of one of the victim's relatives in Burlington, Vermont. US Attorney General Merrick Garland warned of threats from 'domestic violent extremists.'

title: Sweden PM condemns far-right call to tear down mosques
summary: Sweden Democrats leader Jimmie Akesson called for some mosques to be seized and leveled during a speech to his annual party conference on Saturday.

title: After Russia's 'betrayal,' Armenia seeks new allies to ensure its security
summary: The loss of Nagorno-Karabakh has strengthened Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan's determination to diversify his partners.

title: Six teenagers on trial over beheading of French schoolteacher
summary: The murder of Samuel Paty by an 18-year-old radicalized Islamist shocked France.

title: French labor minister goes on trial for alleged favoritism
summary: Olivier Dussopt is suspected of having favored a private company, the Saur group, in the awarding of a water contract when he was mayor of the small town of Annonay.

title: Joe Biden will not attend COP28, according to US official
summary: A US official, speaking on the condition of anonymity, confirmed that the US president will miss the latest UN climate summit after attending the last two years. The official did not give a reason for Biden's decision.

title: Cricket, a political tool for India's Narendra Modi
summary: The Indian prime minister was counting on the national team's victory over Australia in the World Cup final on November 19 to boost his popularity a few months ahead of the general election. But in politics, as in sport, nothing is ever certain.

title: Chinese grandparents play an integral role in childcare
summary: Due to limited childcare options and the necessity for mothers to sustain their careers, the vast majority of households in China rely on grandparents to care for children until they begin elementary school.

title: How is Uganda trying to revamp its textile industry? By banning used-clothes imports
summary: Uganda wants to stop importing used clothes, which are extremely popular, in order to develop its textile industry. The decision is in line with the East African regional bloc's directive but has proven challenging for governments to enforce.

title: Five new hotels in Paris to suit all tastes
summary: For a weekend away or a simple after-work aperitif, in the calm of a lush garden or in an exotic Art Deco bar, here are five quirky new Paris addresses perfect for lounging.
